subject: Dengue virus (DENV)
Text: Dengue virus (DENV) is a flavivirus that infects approximately 390 million people and causes 500,000 infections requiring hospitalization every year, with an associated mortality rate of 2.5%.

subject: NS1
Text: Nonstructural protein 1 (NS1) of dengue virus (DENV) can stimulate endothelial cells to secrete endothelial hyperpermeability factor, macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF), and the glycocalyx degradation factor heparanase 1 (HPA-1).

subject: DENV infection
Text: DENV infection usually causes a flu-like illness, known as dengue fever (DF), which is associated with high-grade fever and joint pain.

subject: dengue patients
Text: Most dengue patients recover without hospitalization, but in some cases, patients develop potentially deadly complications called dengue hemorrhagic fever or dengue shock syndrome (DHF/DSS).

subject: dengue severity
object: dengue with or without warning signs
Text: According to the latest guidelines from the World Health Organization (WHO), dengue severity can be classified into dengue with or without warning signs and severe dengue.

subject: dengue severity
Text: According to the latest guidelines from the World Health Organization (WHO), dengue severity can be classified into dengue with or without warning signs and severe dengue.

subject: DHF/DSS
Text: One of the main characteristics of DHF/DSS or severe dengue is plasma leakage.

subject: vascular permeability
Text: The increase in vascular permeability is the primary cause of plasma leakage, which finally causes hypotension and circulatory collapse.

subject: mechanism
Text: Because the mechanism underlying vascular hyperpermeability during DENV infection is not yet fully understood.

subject: treatments
Text: Only supporting treatments, such as fluid therapy, are available.

subject: endothelial permeability
Text: An increase in endothelial permeability is frequently associated with the degradation of the endothelial glycocalyx [2, 3].

subject: glycocalyx
Text: Under normal physiological conditions, the glycocalyx acts as a barrier that controls numerous physiological processes, especially preventing the adhesion of leucocytes and platelets to the vessel walls [4, 5].

subject: endothelial glycocalyx
Text: Degradation of the endothelial glycocalyx correlates to several vascular pathologies, including sepsis [6, 7].

subject: endothelial glycocalyx
Text: Shedding of the endothelial glycocalyx is related to the activation of a heparan sulfate-specific heparanase, HPA-1.

Text: Studies focusing on the development of neutralizing antibodies or small molecules against MIF may facilitate the development of drugs to prevent or treat severe dengue [53].

subject: DENV infection
Text: The aim of this study was to clarify the mechanism of DENV infection-induced endothelial glycocalyx degradation.

subject: glycocalyx degradation
Text: From analyzing clinical samples, we correlated glycocalyx degradation to MIF secretion.

subject: MIF
Text: By applying the results from other studies, we hypothesized that HPA-1 or MMP-9 was involved in MIF-mediated glycocalyx degradation in dengue.

subject: NS1
Text: This hypothesis was examined via in vitro experiments, which were carried out by recombinant NS1 stimulation, as it was indicated as an important effector in severe dengue.

subject: DENV NS1
Text: Since the interaction between different cell types is critical under physiological conditions, we assessed the DENV NS1-induced effects on both endothelial cells and leukocytes.

subject: DENV NS1

subject: MMPs
Text: To further elucidate the involvement of MMPs in this mechanism, MMP antibody array and gelatin zymography assays were performed.

subject: cell types
Text: Medium used to grow both cell types was supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS; HyClone Laboratory, Logan, UT, USA), and cells were cultured at 37°C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere.

subject: Human leukocytes (WBCs)
Text: Human leukocytes (WBCs) were isolated from the whole blood of healthy donors.

subject: whole blood
Text: After collecting the blood into EDTA-containing plasma tubes, the whole blood was centrifuged at 1000 g for 5 min.

subject: buffy coat
Text: The buffy coat was then collected and treated with red blood cell lysis buffer (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA).

subject: cells
Text: After one wash with PBS, the cells were cultured in serum-free RPMI 1640 at 37°C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere.

subject: Ficoll-Paque
Text: Human PBMCs were isolated from the whole blood of healthy donors using Ficoll-Paque (Sigma-Aldrich) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

subject: blood
Text: Briefly, blood was collected into EDTA-containing vacutainers (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ) and transferred to the top layer of Ficoll-Paque.

subject: PBMCs
Text: After centrifugation at 2500 g for 30 min, the PBMCs were collected and washed with RPMI 1640 twice, and then cultured in RPMI 1640 containing 10% FBS at 37°C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere.

subject: PBMCs
Text: After centrifugation at 2500 g for 30 min, the PBMCs were collected and washed with RPMI 1640 twice, and then cultured in RPMI 1640 containing 10% FBS at 37°C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere.

Text: In brief, lentiviruses were generated from shRNA plasmids (MIF: TRCN0000056818; Luc: TRCN0000072243; National RNAi Core Facility, Academia Sinica, Taipei, Taiwan), and pMD.G and pCMVDR8.91 were cotransfected into HEK 293T cells (American Type Culture Collection, Manassas, VA, USA).

subject: THP-1 cells
Text: THP-1 cells were infected with lentivirus and underwent selection in culture medium containing puromycin (1 μg/ml, Sigma-Aldrich).

subject: NS1

subject: THP-1 cells
Text: After 16 h, THP-1 cells were resuspended in fresh medium without PMA and incubated for another 8 h. NS1 (20 μg/ml) was used to stimulate THP-1 cells, human leukocytes and PBMCs, and the resultant culture supernatants were collected at the indicated time points.

subject: Transwell permeability assay
Text: A Transwell permeability assay was performed as described in a previous study [58].

subject: HUVECs
Text: HUVECs (2 x 10^5) were grown on a Transwell insert (0.4 μm; Corning Life Sciences, Corning, NY, USA) until a monolayer formed.

subject: NS1
Text: The upper chambers were reconstituted with 20 μg/ml NS1, culture supernatant from NS1-activated THP-1 cells, or the inhibitor-containing medium.

subject: streptavidin-horseradish peroxidase (HRP)
Text: After 24 h, the upper chambers were reconstituted with 300 μl of serum-free media containing 4.5 μl of streptavidin-horseradish peroxidase (HRP; R&D Systems, Inc., Minneapolis, MN, USA).

subject: streptavidin-HRP
Text: Next, 20 μl of medium in the lower chamber was collected 5 min after the addition of streptavidin-HRP and was assayed for HRP activity by the addition of 100 μl of 3,3',5,5'-tetramethylbenzidine (TMB) substrate (R&D Systems).

subject: color development
Text: The color development at 450 nm was measured with a VersaMax microplate reader (Molecular Devices, Sunnyvale, CA, USA).

subject: HUVECs

Text: To measure the integrity of the endothelial glycocalyx and the deposition of CD138, the expression of sialic acid was stained with wheat germ agglutinin (WGA) lectin conjugated to FITC (WGA-FITC, Genetex).

subject: HPA-1

subject: recombinant NS1
Text: Before the injection of PBS or recombinant NS1, blood from 8- to 12-week-old BALB/c mice was collected by orbital sinus sampling with 10% citrate.

subject: mice
Text: Next, the mice were intravenously injected with 50 μg of NS1 or 100 μl of PBS.

subject: intravenous injection
Text: After the intravenous injection, blood from the mice was immediately collected by orbital sinus sampling and every 24 h thereafter until 120 h after the injection.

subject: NS1

Text: For the peritoneal challenge, 500 μl of PBS, 50 μg of NS1, 50 μg of E or 50 μg of prM was injected intraperitoneally.

subject: mice
Text: After 24 h, the mice were sacrificed, and the abdominal cavities were washed with 5 ml of PBS.

subject: MIF
Text: The resultant peritoneal lavage was collected, and the concentrations of MIF, HPA-1 and CD138 were quantified by ELISA.

subject: NS1
Text: To further confirm that NS1 induced CD138 shedding in endothelial cells in mice, 50 μg of recombinant NS1, E or prM protein or 50 μl of PBS was subcutaneously injected into 8- to 12-week-old BALB/c mice, followed by a second injection of an equal amount of recombinant proteins or PBS 24 h after the first injection at the same site.

subject: mice
Text: The mice were sacrificed 24 h after the second injection.

subject: formalin

subject: paraffin
Text: The separated skin tissues were fixed in formalin overnight and embedded in paraffin for the preparation of a series of sections.

subject: paraffin
Text: After paraffin removal and antigen retrieval by citrate buffer, the tissue sections were blocked, and immunohistochemistry was performed using the Mouse/Rabbit HRP Detection System with DAB (brown) (BioTnA Biotech, Kaohsiung, Taiwan).

subject: Hematoxylin

subject: Anti-α-SMA antibody
Text: Anti-α-SMA antibody (Arigo, Hsinchu City, Taiwan) was used at 1:200, and anti-CD138 antibody (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ) was used at 1:100.

subject: patients’ sera data
Text: The patients’ sera data were expressed as the median ± interquartile range and tested if the values come from a Gaussian distribution by using D’Agostino and Pearson omnibus normality test.

subject: data
Text: If the data meet Gaussian distribution, the significance of differences between each groups was analyzied using One-way ANOVA with Tukey’s method.

subject: data
Text: If the data do not meet the assumptions of normality, they were analyzed with a non-parametric test by Kruskal-Wallis test.

subject: in vitro data
Text: The in vitro and in vivo data are expressed as the mean ± standard deviation (SD) from more than three independent experiments.

subject: Student’s t-test
Text: Student’s t-test was used to analyze the significance of differences between the test and control groups.

subject: One-way ANOVA
Text: One-way ANOVA with Kruskal-Wallis comparison test was used to analyze the significance of differences between multiple groups.

subject: data
Text: All data were analyzed by GraphPad Prism 5 software.

subject: P values
Text: P values <0.05 were considered statistically significant.
